text:
Hey guys, it’s Ro! Welcome to another Nerdy
Nummies!

Today, I got a lot of requests for something
Walking Dead, so we are gonna

be making scary cupcakes! We are gonna be
making for the first time,
red velvet cupcakes!

The things that you will need today, will
be: Red velvet cake mix, if you

don’t have box cake, just use your favorite
recipe, whatever that may be!

1/3 cup of oil, 1-1/4 cup of water, 3 eggs
and 1 big mixing bowl and a whisk
or electric beater, whatever you like.
OK, let’s put this all together! Errp!
Oh!

And you’ll notice when you add the water,
before the cake mix kind of looked

chocolate-y, and now it’s gonna start to
look red, like so!
It looks pretty cool, it looks really bloody!

And then mix your batter until it’s nice
and smooth.

Once you’ve finished mixing your batter
and it’s nice and smooth,

what you’re gonna want to do is line your
cupcake tray with these paper liners,

and, I use a spoon, I’m just gonna scoop.
Eragh! It looks like blood!
And fill them about 3/4 full.

After your cupcakes are done baking, make
sure that they’ve had plenty of time

to cool before you start frosting. We are
gonna frost them with cream cheese

frosting because red velvet cake goes really,
really well with cream cheese

frosting! And what I did is I scooped a bunch
of this frosting into a plastic

bag with 1 of these fancy tips, and I’m
just gonna, brrrrooooop!
Do it to each cupcake!

Now that we’ve got our cupcakes frosted,
doo-doo!

Now it’s time to decorate! We’re gonna
start with the brains, I got this mold

from Think Geek, it’s actually an ice cube
tray, but you can use them all the same.

Rubber, put it in the freezer,
no big deal. So we’re gonna fill

it with chocolate melts, they’re pink chocolate
melts! I would suggest

getting the Wilton, because this is the right
color pink that you want for

the brain. There’s lots of other brands,
but their pinks are too bright pink.
This is the perfect color for brains! Ber-ber-ber-ber-ber!

So you’re gonna take these chocolate melts
and put them in the microwave,

and then we’re gonna scoop them into a bag
and fill these little candy molds.

Just like we did on the other episode, with
the chocolate frogs!

Just poured all of the melted chocolate into
this plastic bag, and I just

tied it off with a hair tie. And you’re
gonna take your baking scissors,
just cut the end, and then fill these brains!

Ta-da! It actually worked! We had to leave
these in the freezer a little longer

than I had originally thought, these stayed
in for about 20 minutes, because

they’re just very dense, but they look awesome!
Check these out!

They actually look like creepy brains so it
was perfect!

Now, what we’re gonna do, is I took 3 cupcakes,
and we have red raspberry

puree. Um, here’s the brand, in case you
ever want to purchase it.

I already bought it made, but there are recipes
online if you want to make
your own puree.

So what we’re gonna do, is I’m gonna take
a little, eh, take a little teaspoon!
I’m just gonna go like this, kinda make…

A bed in the middle, a bed of blood! In the
middle of your cupcake.

Then you’re gonna take your brain, stick
it on there, press it down,
let the blood drip! Errrr! Pretty cool!

And then I’m taking this little paintbrush,
and I’m just gonna splatter
blood all over the brains.

Now that we got our brain cupcakes done, we
are gonna make sheriff badge

cupcakes, yay, for Rick! So what I did is
I took a little bit of powdered

sugar, just a pinch. Put it on the table so
that, your fondant doesn’t

stick to the table. If you don’t want to
use fondant you can just use yellow

frosting to draw a sheriff’s badge,
or airheads, or anything you want.

But I’m using fondant! So just take a little
bit of yellow fondant.
And you don’t need a lot.

You could even use a flattened starburst if
you wanted to.

You’re just gonna roll it out a little bit,
merp-merp-merp!

The cookie cutters that I’m going to use
to make the sheriff’s badge is going

to be a circle, and this little triangle point.
And the reason I’m not using

a star is because… Those, those ones are
used like in Toy Story, but the actual

sheriff badges have 7 points! So, what you’re
gonna do is cut out the circle,
meep-meep-meep-meep-meep!
And then, cut out 7 triangles.
And then you’re just gonna line ‘em up!
Put ‘em all the way around.

Like so, and It kind of looks like a sun, so you can
just take a little, um, toothpick and kinda just

shape them a little bit different so that
it looks more like a badge.

Now the last thing that we’re gonna do to
decorate our sheriff’s badges,

here it is, all done. I just put it separately
on this little tray so we could

see it. You’re gonna take black frosting,
you can take 1 of these fine tips,

put him right on top, so you don’t have
to use a plastic bag!

And then you can reseal it and keep using
it, pretty cool!
No wonder they do this!

And now we’re gonna just, take your time,
and write the word sheriff across
the badge.
Ta-da!

Our creepy walking dead cupcakes are done!
We have our bloody brains

in the back. And our sheriff, Rick’s sheriff
badge is in the front.

I love these! I think these are the creepiest
cupcakes I’ve ever done!

And, they turned out way better than I thought
and they were really easy
to do, so I hope you liked them.

If you have any other ideas for any other
Nerdy Nummies, please leave me a

comment below and I will do my best to make
it happen!

And, this is October, so if you have any other
creepy ideas, I like those the
most! Put those down there, for Halloween!
OK, thanks so much!
Bye-bye!
